definition: to consider/to allow for/to use one's discretion/to measure (food and drink)
to pour wine/to drink wine/to deliberate/to consider
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Add the finely chopped onion and oil. Mix thoroughly. Check the seasoning and adjust accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 加入洋葱碎及食油，拌匀，试味并酌量再调味。

sentences.english: Reduced the cooldown on Northrend Alchemy Resemid-foot from 7 days to 3 days.
sentences.chinese: 诺森德炼金学酌量的冷却时间从7天低落到3天。

sentences.english: Add warm pancetta and fat from pan. Toss well. Thin sauce with additional cream, if necessary.
sentences.chinese: 如果需要的话，可以酌量添加少量奶油。

sentences.english: Wead like you to consider our request once yet again.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望贵方再次酌量我们的央求。

sentences.english: Among those titles, this text inclines to Zhuo-Liang Punishment.
sentences.chinese: 在诸多称谓中，本文倾向于使用“酌量减轻”。

sentences.english: The baker measured out the necessary ingredients to bake a cake.
sentences.chinese: 面包师酌量量出必要的配料来烘烤蛋糕。

sentences.english: You can consider the situation of children's dietary supplement.
sentences.chinese: 你可以根据孩子的饮食情况酌量补充。

sentences.english: I think we should consider sending a man to Jingzhou to substitute for General Guan and bring Guan back before we go into battle.
sentences.chinese: 吾欲酌量着一人去荆州，替回关将军来，方可敌之。

sentences.english: There are things to take into consideration.
sentences.chinese: 还有许多需要酌量的事务。

definition: to give as one sees fit
